title: Internship Interview
Interview Descriptions: Great Interview Process, got to know everyone. enjoyed every experience, fun atmosphere and unique compared to other universities. was able to know exactly what my role was before going into the job which was nice!
Interview Questions:
strengths and weakness
How long have you worked at your current job

title: IT Help Desk Graduate Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the Asst. Dir. IT Svc Mgmt & Comm. Was a quick and painless interview with typically interview questions asked. One question was "Why do you think you would be a good fit for this role?"
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this role?

title: Annual Giving Officer Interview
Interview Descriptions: Good Interview very personable they really want to get to know you. they show you around. you interview with one person then the other and then they make you do a writing sample. They give 20 mins to do that and they have a couple of prompts for you to answer
Interview Questions: What skillsets did you bring to the table?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was completed in a back and forth QA format. Didn't take more than 20 minutes. Done with a panel of people you would be working with. Students, supervisors, etc.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe you?

title: Mail Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and personable. The interview was conducted via zoom but the interviewer was very open and receptive. The questions were standard interview questions looking to learn more about you as an applicant.
Interview Questions: What was an instance where you demonstrated exceptional leadership

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Tour of the building, got shown the parts under construction and potentially my own lab space. Research talk only with both students and professors in the audience. One-on-one meetings with individual faculty members and the president of the college. Meetings with group of not too enthusiastic students. Dinner with two faculty members.
Interview Questions: Mostly general questions. Why do you choose this institution?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI)
Interview Descriptions: this is my attempt to write thirty words.  here is four words.  here are four more.  and here are five words.  Do you want more?  I can say more you know.  I believe I'm at 30 now.  Or maybe I'm close, I'm not sure. word word word word word.  word word word word word.  Here is 30.  I'm tired. This is long enough.

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence College in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was an initial phone screen. Nice to see that PC is working to make accountability part of student service. I was very encouraged that PC is open to a new approach for supporting students.
Interview Questions: Asked about approach to career services.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was so amazing! the group processing is really fun. If you make it past that then you get to have a individual interview it is a great chance to know reslife and the staff
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate?

title: Office Assistant In Sociology Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very friendly and seemed to like me. We had a bunch of back to back emails discussing the hours I would be free every week and she made it seem like they were hiring me. They emailed a week later saying they went in a different direction.
Interview Questions: What would you do on your down time?

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence College
Interview Descriptions: They call you about salaries first.  If you don't match, you will not move on.  Do some research beforehand.  Phone conversation was cold and unwelcoming.  It might help to know people.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI)
Interview Descriptions: Typical process for academics.  Initial interview at conference, followed with campus interview.  Everyone was super nice during the entire process.  The campus interview began with a research presentation in the morning followed with individual meetings with faculty members.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence College (Providence, RI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online then followed up over the phone. The process took around 15 days. The interview was not hard at all. Two people asked you general questions mostly about availability and experience. About five days after he interview I received an offer.
Interview Questions: Q. Do you have any customer service experience?
